00055     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00056     /// @namespace phys::xml
00057     /// @brief The components to load, save, modify, and use XML will be stored here
00058     /// @details This is where objects that help with loading, saving, and
00059     /// manipulating xml documents will reside. This components found here are simply
00060     /// a tight wrapper around TinyXMLcpp with some integration with the rest of the
00061     /// physgame engine to allow some enhanced functionality (like using Ogre's nifty
00062     /// File loading system). The only changes made to TiCPP were to remove the
00063     /// private and protected Sections of TiCPP::Base and make all the members public
00064     /// so that phys::xml could tightly integrate with them. We did this
00065     /// So we could avoid reimplementing certain case functionality and make use of
00066     /// TinyXML better. \n \n
00067     ///
00068     /// Here is the original Copyright notice that came with our copy of TiCPP, and show

00110         ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00111         /// @class Base
00112         /// @headerfile xmlbase.h
00113         /// @brief A set of all functionality that all XML components must implement
00114         /// @details All XML components inherit from this. This is the most basic level
00115         /// of functionality that all XML components will implement. Even though it is
00116         /// has no pure virtual methods, this class should still not be instantiated.
00117         /// Not that doing so would damage anything, it just wasn't designed to be used
00118         /// that way.
00119         ///
00120         /// @warning All Member that inherit from this class are expected to behave a
00121         /// certain way with respect the
00122         class Base
00123         {
00124             protected:
00125                 /// @internal
00126                 /// @brief A pointer to the Library level object we are wrapping to implement this functionality
00127                 ticpp::Base *Wrapped;
00128 
00129                 /// @internal
00130                 /// @brief Become responsible for deleting shared data.
00131                 /// @details Each TinyXML class instance can store a pointer to anything. When one of our classes is being deconstructed, if that pointer
00132                 /// points the the member being deconstructed, then it gets deleted too. This assumes that ownershipA\n
00133                 /// Non-Thread safe, this is one of those items that would have to be  Mutex encapsulated to  be made thread safe
00134                 void TakeOwnerOfWrapped();
00135 
00136                 /// @internal
00137                 /// @brief Stop being responsible for deleting shared data.
00138                 /// @details Each TinyXML class instance can store a pointer to anything. When one of our classes is being deconstructed, if that pointer
00139                 /// points the the member being deconstructed, then it gets deleted too. By default this removes that ownener\n
00140                 /// Non-Thread safe, this is one of those items that would have to be  Mutex encapsulated to  be made thread safe
00141                 /// @param WhoIsResponsible A Void Pointer that default to 0, this can be used to make the TinyXML node think something else wraps which will have specific effects in phys::xml::base derived code.
00142                 void DropOwnerShipOfWrapped(void* WhoIsResponsible=0);
00143 
00144             public:
00145                 /// @brief This is used to identify what kind of component you are working with, in conjunction with the GetType() function
00146                 enum XMLComponentType
00147                 {
00148                     //isBase,                   /*< Indicates the XMLComponent is a Base, and not a node, and should never exist like this. */
00149                     isAttribute,              /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is an attribute, and not a node */
00150                     //isNode,                   /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and nothing else and should be used*/
00151                     isComment,                /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00152                     isDeclaration,            /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00153                     isDocument,               /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00154                     isElement,                /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00155                     isStylesheetReference,    /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00156                     isText,                   /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00157                     isUnknown                 /**< Indicates the XMLComponent is a node and */
00158                 };
00159 
00160                 /// @brief In Plain english what is this class
00161                 /// @return This returns the type of this class spelled out in a String
00162                 virtual String GetTypeAsString() const;
00163 
00164                 /// @brief Convert XMLComponentType to plain English
00165                 /// @param NodeType The part that you wnatin plain english
00166                 /// @return This returns the type spelled out in a String
00167                 static String GetTypeAsString(XMLComponentType NodeType);
00168 
00169                 /// @brief Return the position, in the original source file, of this node or attribute.
00170                 /// @details Return the position, in the original source file, of this node or attribute. The row and column are 1-based.
00171                 /// (That is the first row and first column is 1,1). If the returns values are 0 or less, then the parser does not have
00172                 /// a row and column value. \n \n
00173                 /// Generally, the row and column value will be set when the Document::Load(), Document::LoadFile(), or any Node::Parse()
00174                 /// is called. It will NOT be set when the DOM was created from operator>>. \n \n
00175                 /// The values reflect the initial load. Once the DOM is modified programmatically (by adding or changing nodes and
00176                 /// attributes) the new values will NOT update to reflect changes in the document. \n \n
00177                 /// There is a minor performance cost to computing the row and column. Computationcan be disabled if
00178                 /// Document::SetTabSize() is called with 0 as the value.
00179                 /// @return Returns an int.
00180                 int Row() const;
00181 
00182                 /// @brief Return the position, in the original source file, of this node or attribute.
00183                 /// @details See Row()
00184                 /// @return Returns an int.
00185                 int Column() const;
00186 
00187                 // @brief Set a pointer to arbitrary user data.
00188                 // @param user This can be a pointer to any data that is required.
00189                 // @details Sometimes it is too useful to be able to apply extras information, this seems to be the most appropriate place for that functionality.
00190                 //void SetUserData (void *user);
00191                 // @brief Get a pointer to arbitrary user data.
00192                 // @details Returns gibberish (not always 0) if SetUserData was not called. Could be invalid, or not, make sure that you set it if you plan on
00193                 // using it, and set See SetUserData(void*) .
00194                 // @return This returns a pointer to something, it is up to you (or the game programmer) to determine what that means.
00195                 //void* GetUserData();
00196                 // @brief See GetUserData()
00197                 //const void* GetUserData () const;
00198 
00199                 /// @brief Equality comparison operation based on internal data
00200                 /// @param OtherBase Another XML object that will be compared
00201                 /// @details Compare internal TiXml pointers to determine if both are wrappers around the same node.
00202                 /// @return A bool containing true if the internal pointers match
00203                 bool operator== (const Base &OtherBase) const;
00204 
00205                 /// @brief Inquality comparison operation based on internal data
00206                 /// @param OtherBase Another XML object that will be compared
00207                 /// @details Compare internal TiXml pointers to determine if both are wrappers around the same node.
00208                 /// @return A bool containing false if the internal pointers match
00209                 bool operator!= (const Base &OtherBase) const;
00210 
00211                 /// @brief Used to get details about issues suitable for the the user or detailed logs
00212                 /// @details Builds detailed error string using TiXmlDocument::Error() and others.
00213                 /// @return This returns a string that contains the current error information [I think that is what happens anyway.]
00214                 virtual String BuildDetailedErrorString() const;
00215 
00216                 /// @brief Handles the deleting of enclosed data
00217                 virtual ~Base();
00218 
00219                 /// @brief This Will be by Child classes to aid in identification
00220                 /// @return Classes that inherit from this are expected to return an XMLComponentType that indicates what kind of XML component they are.
00221                 virtual XMLComponentType GetType() const = 0;
00222 
00223                 /// @brief Get the value of this XML Object.
00224                 /// @return this returns a String containing the value of this attribute.
00225                 virtual String GetValueAsString() const = 0;
00226 
00227                 /// @brief Get the value of this XML Object converted to a Whole Number.
00228                 /// @return this returns a Whole containing the value of this attribute.
00229                 virtual Whole GetValueAsWhole() const = 0;
00230 
00231                 /// @brief Get the value of this XML Object converted to a Real Number.
00232                 /// @return this returns a Real containing the value of this attribute.
00233                 virtual Real GetValueAsReal() const = 0;
00234 
00235                 /// @brief Set the value of this XML Object.
00236                 /// @param value A Whole number to be inserted into the XML document
00237                 virtual void SetValue(const Whole &value) = 0;
00238 
00239                 /// @brief Set the value of this XML Object.
00240                 /// @param value A Real number to be inserted into the XML document
00241                 virtual void SetValue(const Real &value) = 0;
00242 
00243                 /// @brief Set the value of this XML Object.
00244                 /// @param value A String number to be inserted into the XML document
00245                 virtual void SetValue(const String &value) = 0;
00246         }; // /Base

00248     }// /xml
00249 }// /phys
